thag12.2:1.1: I was born in a low-class family.
thag12.2:1.2: We were poor, with little to eat.
thag12.2:1.4: I threw out the old flowers.
thag12.2:2.2: I was disregarded and held in contempt.
thag12.2:2.4: and paid respects to many people.
thag12.2:3.2: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha;
thag12.2:3.4: was entering the capital city of Magadhā.
thag12.2:5.1: When I had paid homage at the Teacher’s feet,
thag12.2:6.2: and having compassion for the whole world,
thag12.2:7.3: I have completed what the Teacher taught,
thag12.2:7.4: just as the victor advised me.
thag12.2:8.1: In the first watch of the night,
thag12.2:8.3: In the middle watch of the night,
thag12.2:8.5: In the last watch of the night,
thag12.2:8.6: I shattered the mass of darkness.
thag12.2:9.1: At the end of the night,
thag12.2:9.4: and revered me with joined hands.
thag12.2:10.2: Homage to you, supreme among men!
thag12.2:10.4: you, sir, are worthy of a religious donation.”
thag12.2:12.3: that’s how to become a brahmin,
